nodes.title: How & Why to Move to the Country Part 3
nodes.description: Through our not-so-normal testimony, we aim to encourage you with the reality that there is no one way to experience country living. Come and har how God led us to our ‘Living Parable’.

nodes.title: Agriculture in Our Schools & Institutions Part 1
nodes.description: Many schools are awakening to the fact that agriculture is supposed to the A, B and C of our education. But the question is: “How do we do that?” AdAgra is committed to helping schools with this challenge and has formed a working group that is developing curriculum and a quick-start manual to meet this need. Join us to be inspired with ways to make agriculture a viable option at your school or institution.

nodes.title: Market Gardening Part 6
nodes.description: The objective of this class is to equip you with details on how you can successfully grow flowers in early spring, summer and fall. Michelle will be sharing her favorite flower varieties and other tips she has learned through her farming experience. Whether you are just starting out with growing flowers or you have gown them for years, you will enjoy this class full of so much lover for flowers.

nodes.title: Market Gardening Part 5
nodes.description: There’s more to growing than meets the eye! During this class the Delays will share knowledge they have gained over their last nine years of gardening for market. They will cover topics such as planting, seeding, weed management, irrigation, etc.

nodes.title: Greater Efficiencies for Home Gardens Part 3
nodes.description: This class will look at strategies and methods to get maximum efficiencies of space, yield and labor from home gardens. It will include plans to help you know what your annual results, costs and rewards will be before you event start.
